Use std::function instead, signature of this callback should be well known
Use std::function instead, signature of this callback should be well known

nit:
prefer int32_t{0} over int32_t(0).

First one creates int32_t from given value and verify value range.
Second one is c style cast from 0 to int32_t you can put value that is outside range of int32_t and it will compile, while int32_t{...} would cause compilation error.
Do we have such alias already? Even if we don't, I don't prefer we put it here. There's a dbus utility lib.
This kind of global static object without trivial constructor is dangerous. I prefer you use std::string_view with inline constexpr.
Do we have an alias here?

Function with name like this will pollute the whole redfish namespace. 

Consider move to dbus_utility.hpp?

> Function with name like this will pollute the whole redfish namespace. 
> 
> Consider move to dbus_utility.hpp?

Good idea
Done

Apologize for the back and forth, I realized that we prefer inplace string literals nowadays for better readability and search-ability. 

So just delete this global variable and use string literals.
No error? didn't the user just PATCH this?
But this is a set, shouldn't this be an error
I don't see this done in patch set 9
Shouldn't this always be specifying an interface?

> Seems like we lost this..?

No, I dont think so.
1. enclosure_identify_blink is not used, even in IBM's association.json and ledgroup-config.json, there is no adaptation.
2. This association does not distinguish whether there is a blink, as long as the corresponding path is associated with the ledgroup, we can get the Asserted attribute

Moving away from
 "/xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/enclosure_identify",
 "/xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/enclosure_identify_blink",

and to this identify_led_group association, does everyone know, is there backend implementations for this identify_led_group association?

> Moving away from
>  "/xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/enclosure_identify",
>  "/xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/enclosure_identify_blink",

No
For PIM, these paths should be configured to the association.json
For EM, dynamically configured to the association

> 
> and to this identify_led_group association, does everyone know, is there backend implementations for this identify_led_group association?

refer: https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/LED-architecture.md#resource-identify-operation
Okay, has PIM or EM done this?

> Okay, has PIM or EM done this?

PIM has done, But I am not sure EM
This is where "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory" is limited, or"/"is fine.

> This is where "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory" is limited, or"/"is fine.

At present, I think `/` is reasonable, because we are not sure whether the `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.System` of other services must be under `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory`, if there is a standard definition here, I will change it.

> At present, I think `/` is reasonable

If we're trying to get inventory interfaces, we should be looking under the inventory dbus path.  There was a discussion about this on the mailing list.

> Is this documented somewhere?
> 
> https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/search?q=identify_led_group&type=

I answered this question once.
refer: https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/LED-architecture.md#redfish
nit: you don't need these curly bracket. std::string service will be default get it an empty string

Common error #1

This also assumes that there's only 1 service in the list, completely ignoring the DBus usage rules.
I see. Need to check size

these are generally not passed as const values.

const boost::system::error_code& ec, bool assert

Is what I would expect here.
Maybe for the author: when will this dbus call throw error?

LocationIndicator is different than the LED state, and should only return true if the device is currently trying to be located, and for no other reason.  Is that modeled in the backend?  This path looks like it's based on the direct value of the property.

> LocationIndicator is different than the LED state, and should only return true if the device is currently trying to be located, and for no other reason.  Is that modeled in the backend?  This path looks like it's based on the direct value of the property.

Sorry, I am not following.
Because the previous logic is like this, here I just do the refactor, @Gunnar, What do you think?

I thought the LocationIndicatorActive mapped to the relevant led group so seems correct to me.  The client would PATCH this, and GET its value. These are on the inventory page on the GUI as a toggle. This seems correct to me.

Please don't hardcode paths like this.  Use the mapper to look them up without having to do a direct string comparison.

Common error #12

> Please don't hardcode paths like this.  Use the mapper to look them up without having to do a direct string comparison.
> 
> Common error #12

Sorry, Do you mean we should use mapper to find paths like `/xyz/openbmc_project/.../identify_led_group`?

I think we should use association to obtain the ledGroup whose rType is equal to identify_led_group. So I do not think here is hardcode.

https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/LED-architecture.md#redfish

> > Please don't hardcode paths like this.  Use the mapper to look them up without having to do a direct string comparison.
> > 
> > Common error #12
> 
> Sorry, Do you mean we should use mapper to find paths like `/xyz/openbmc_project/.../identify_led_group`?
> 
> I think we should use association to obtain the ledGroup whose rType is equal to identify_led_group. So I do not think here is hardcode.
> 
> https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/LED-architecture.md#redfish

@Ed, For this association, it has been merged by: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/58299
Please use a more specific check here.  Not all errors are non-existence errors in the mapper.

> Please use a more specific check here.  Not all errors are non-existence errors in the mapper.

I only refer to L: 2999 here. If this is an error, other places should also be modified synchronously.

I added a systems_utils.hpp to obtain a valid systemID.
This is going to set ALL leds within this tree.  That's almost certainly not what's intended by the user
Why is this looking for Item.System?  Shouldn't this be looking for LED instances attached to a system?

> Why is this looking for Item.System?  Shouldn't this be looking for LED instances attached to a system?

No, Looking for Item.System is used to obtain the object path of the valid systemId. It has been refactored here
If object is empty, this branch of code still crashes, doesn't it?

> If object is empty, this branch of code still crashes, doesn't it?

I dont think so, the ec wont be equal to 0 if object is empty right?
Are you sure this is expected change? I though it was suggested to const boost::system::error_code& and keep bool just a boll (without const).

> Are you sure this is expected change? I though it was suggested to const boost::system::error_code& and keep bool just a boll (without const).

Yes, Because I don't want to update code not related to this commit to merge this commit, for these changes I will improve it in future commits.

No, I do not think that is correct(lines 3066-3071), I will fix it in the next commit, but not the current commit.
Because for this URL(/redfish/v1/Systems/<str>), systemName may be other values, in other words, systemID does not have to be equal to system, maybe system1,system2...
